Image Quality.comm: The lens offers excellent image quality.

cont.entity_a: Better image quality and sharpness compared to the 28mm. Images are true to life with no distortion and are tack sharp at all apertures.
The build quality of the 28mm lens is superior with a silent and smooth focus ring.
cont.entity_b: Well-built and durable, but heavier compared to zoom lenses. Build quality is solid, with fast and quiet autofocus.

cont.entity_a: The 28mm lens is effective for low-light conditions, reducing the need for a flash. Performance in low light is commendable with good image quality at higher ISO settings. The 28mm lens performs well in low-light indoor settings without a flash.

Versatility.comm: Suitable for both full-frame and crop sensors.

cont.entity_a: The 28mm lens is versatile for both crop and full-frame cameras, suitable for various photography styles. The lens provides a wide angle suitable for indoor and landscape photography. The 28mm lens is a good choice for those with cropped sensor cameras for a normal prime perspective.
Fast autofocus and excellent for candid photography with a shallow depth of field.
cont.entity_b: Fast and accurate autofocus, suitable for portraits and quick action shots. Focus speed is sufficient for capturing fast-moving subjects.

The lens is compact and reasonably priced, offering good value for the cost.

The lens provides extremely sharp images and smooth bokeh. The 85mm lens is ideal for portraits, providing creamy bokeh and sharp focus.
